citation.article-title: Pontibacter actiniarum gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel member of the phylum 'Bacteroidetes', and proposal of Reichenbachiella gen. nov. as a replacement for the illegitimate prokaryotic generic name Reichenbachia Nedashkovskaya et al. 2003.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Reichenbachiella agariperforans comb. nov. (illegitimate basonym Nedashkovskaya et al. 2003)

Reichenbachiella agariperforans [a.ga.ri.per.fo′rans. N.L. n. agarum agar (algal polysaccharide); L. part. adj. perforans perforating (making holes); N.L. part. adj. agariperforans making holes in agar, bacterium making deep hollows in agar].
The description is as given by Nedashkovskaya et al. (2003) with the following additional characteristics.
The type strain can form acid from l-arabinose, d-cellobiose, d-glucose and N-acetylglucosamine.
According to the API 50 CH gallery (bioMérieux), it can form acid from arbutin and aesculin.

Can produce leucine- and valine-arylamidases, trypsin, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α- and β-galactosidases, α- and β-glucosidases, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase and alkaline and acid phosphatases, but not esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), lipase (C14), cystine arylamidase, α-chymotrypsin, β-glucuronidase, α-mannosidase or α-fucosidase.
The predominant fatty acids are C15 : 0 iso (28·6 %), C16 : 1ω5c (21·9 %) and summed feature 3 (20·7 %; comprising C15 : 0 iso 2-OH and/or C16 : 1ω7).
The type strain, KMM 3525T (=NBRC 16625T=JCM 11238T), was isolated from sea water collected in Amursky Bay, Pacific Ocean.
